meta.purpose: Official product definitions to prevent misunderstanding
meta.note: Studio is NOT just Omnichannel - it's broader than OA

Studio.definition: PulsePoint's comprehensive audience strategy building and activation platform
Studio.purpose: Build, manage, and activate audience strategies across multiple channels and use cases
Studio.broader_than: Omnichannel Audiences - Studio supports multiple use cases beyond just OA
Studio.not_limited_to: Omnichannel use cases - Studio serves multiple audience types

key_features.workspaces: Logical containers that organize data access, permissions, and activations
key_features.segments: Rules-based audience definitions using NPI lists or HCP attributes
key_features.activations: Connections to external platforms where audiences are delivered
key_features.live_lists: Dynamically updated audiences based on engagement filters

Workspace.definition: Logical containers within Studio that organize and scope access to audience data and activations
Workspace.purpose: Provide data isolation, user access control, and platform-specific integrations

types.extension: Specialized workspace with added contextual filters and inheritance logic

workflow: User selects/creates workspace scoped to advertiser
Defines audience rules using available filters

HCP365.definition: Healthcare professional engagement and analytics platform
HCP365.purpose: Track and analyze HCP interactions across touchpoints

Life.definition: Media activation and campaign management platform
Life.purpose: Campaign setup, media buying, and optimization

Signal.definition: Data collection and audience intelligence platform
Signal.purpose: Capture and process audience signals for targeting

Adaptive_Optimization.definition: AI-powered campaign optimization platform that automatically adjusts bidding, targeting, and creative strategies
Adaptive_Optimization.purpose: Maximize campaign performance through continuous machine learning optimization

features: Advanced ML models for audience optimization
